title: Things 3 SQLite database file export converted into a markdown file and a csv file
description: I need a tool to convert an SQLite database from Things 3 to a markdown file for uploading into mem.ai and a csv file to upload into todoist.com. Todoist.com instructions: https://todoist.com/help/articles/format-a-csv-file-to-import-into-todoist-UVUXTmm6 Mem.ai instructions for markdown file: "Mem doesn't directly support importing data from an SQLite database file. However, you can work around this by exporting your data from Things 3 into a format that Mem can handle, such as Markdown. Here's a step-by-step approach you might consider: Export from Things 3 the SQLite database file. Convert to Markdown/Text: Use a tool or script to convert the exported data into Markdown. This step is crucial as Mem can import this formats. Format it so that each item is clearly separated, using headers or other markers. Import into Mem: Once you have your data in Markdown or plain text, you can import it into Mem. Go to the "Import from apps" section in Mem and follow the instructions to upload your files."

title: Custom Analysis Web Dashboard
description: Install and Setup the Energy Management System (EMS): Task: The contractor is responsible for the full installation and configuration of the EMS across assets. Details: This includes setting up the system to monitor and manage energy usage for approximately 100 General Services-managed assets, ranging from small facilities like parking garages to large buildings like the Historic Courthouse. Each asset may have multiple utility accounts, and the EMS must be capable of handling this complexity. Provide Associated Training and Support: Task: The contractor must provide comprehensive training to personnel on how to use and maintain the EMS. Details: Training should cover all aspects of the system, including data entry, report generation, dashboard usage, and troubleshooting. Additionally, ongoing support should be available to address any issues or questions that arise post-installation. Develop an Analytical Dashboard: Task: The software must include an analytical dashboard that provides clear and actionable insights. Details: The dashboard should be designed to help us track progress towards environmental and fiscal goals. It should offer customizable views and reports that highlight key metrics, such as energy consumption, cost savings, and carbon footprint reductions. Ensure Effective Data Capture and Organization: Task: The EMS must capture and organize data from various sources, including electricity, gas, water, and other utilities. Details: Data should be collected automatically from utility providers and integrated into the system in a standardized format. The EMS should support multiple data delivery methods and ensure that all relevant information is accurately captured and organized for analysis. Integrate the EMS with Existing Systems: Task: The contractor must ensure seamless integration of the EMS with our existing technical environment. Details: This includes integration with existing financial systems, existing energy management tools, and any other relevant software. The integration should allow for data sharing and collaboration between systems, ensuring a unified approach to energy management. Specify Required Resources : Task: The contractor must provide a detailed estimate of the resources that we will need to allocate during the setup phase. Details: This includes identifying the personnel, time, and equipment required from our side to support the installation and setup of the EMS. The contractor should provide a timeline and resource allocation plan to ensure that we are fully prepared. Propose and Implement a Bill Import Tool: Task: The contractor must develop or propose a bill import tool that can handle all types of utility bills. Details: The tool should be capable of importing bills in various formats (e.g., PDF, Excel, XML) from different utility providers. It should automate the process of entering bill data into the EMS and support error-checking to ensure accuracy. Ensure Technical Compatibility and Security: Task: The contractor’s solution must be fully compatible with existing IT infrastructure and meet all security requirements. Details: The EMS should be compatible with current operating systems, databases, and network configurations. The contractor must also implement security measures to protect data, including encryption, user authentication, and backup solutions. Specify Hosting and Data Recovery Solutions: Task: The contractor must provide details on how the EMS will be hosted and ensure that data recovery solutions are in place. Details: This includes deciding whether the EMS will be hosted on-premises, in the cloud, or through a hybrid approach. The contractor must also implement data backup and recovery procedures to protect against data loss and ensure business continuity.

title: FloodVision Data Processing Consultant
description: Position type: Part-time, hourly independent contract (10-20 hours per week) Location: Remote (Continental US preferred; Eastern time zone preferred) About Climate Central and FloodVision: Climate Central is an independent organization of leading scientists and journalists who research and report the facts about our changing climate and its impact on the public. Our mission is to communicate the science and effects of climate change to the public and decision-makers. FloodVisionⓇ (https://climatecentral.org/floodvision) is one of Climate Central’s most exciting initiatives. Using data collected with custom field equipment, FloodVisionⓇ is designed to communicate potential flood risk from storm events and sea level rise to individuals, organizations, and authorities responsible for resilience and adaptation planning and to help emergency managers communicate potential flood risk and plan for storm events. We are searching for a consultant to help us perform routine processing of the large amounts of data generated by the FloodVisionⓇ rover in the field. Core Responsibilities: As a FloodVisionⓇ Data Processing Consultant, your key duties will include periodic handling of data that will be shipped to you from the field. You will use a variety of custom applications, some of which are provided by 3rd parties, and some of which we have developed within Climate Central. No prior experience with these applications is necessary. We will train you in the process. But to give you a sense of the work, tasks will typically include: Data Ingestion and Integrity: - Receive hard drives containing field data regularly (~3 times per week). - Examine field data for integrity and validity; repair data using provided custom software. GPS Data Processing: - Use custom software (Novatel Inertial Explorer) to correct raw GPS data for atmospheric conditions. - Validate data quality and use the software to repair any issues as needed. Data Upload and Management: - Upload processed data to the cloud (uploads typically around 300GB). - Return hard drives to the field team. Video and LIDAR Processing: - Run custom software to split video and LIDAR data into aligned frames. - Monitor job progress, which may take 12-24 hours on Climate Central’s cloud servers; repair alignment issues as necessary. GPS Alignment with Ground Control Points: - Use custom software to align GPS data with ground control points identified in video data. Additionally, as need and availability allows, other tasks may include: - Execute additional programs to identify ground floor elevations in imagery as needed. - Assist in annotating, labeling, and cleaning data. - Contribute to developing further automation or finding efficiencies in the FloodVision data processing pipeline. Qualifications: - Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent training. - Proficiency in , particularly with data manipulation, processing, and visualization tools such as NumPy, Pandas, and Matplotlib. - Basic understanding of machine learning concepts; familiarity with libraries like TensorFlow or PyTorch is a plus. - Familiarity with GIS software such as QGIS or GDAL is a plus. Strong technical aptitude and eagerness to learn about GIS, machine learning, and high-performance computing. - Access to a reliable high-speed internet connection (1 Gbps download/upload preferred). Climate Central may subsidize an internet upgrade if required and available in your area. Additional Information: - This is a remote, part-time, hourly independent contract position. Hourly rate will be in the range of $35-$65/hour, depending on qualifications. Applicants must be based within the continental United States. Preference will be given to candidates in the Eastern time zone. The consultant is expected to work between 10-20 hours per week, with flexibility in scheduling to accommodate the demands of the project. Climate Central offers an opportunity to contribute to a vital project with real-world impact, working with a passionate team at the forefront of climate science communication. How to Apply: Interested candidates should submit a resume and cover letter outlining their relevant experience and interest in the FloodVisionⓇ project.

title: Biomedical iOS App
description: Searching for a Java and Python programmer with experience building programs in the cloud and developing Android apps. Additional experience with Bluetooth-connected hardware devices like EEG is preferred but not required. Develop a cloud-based program for clinicians that interacts with an Android tablet and a dry wireless EEG device through a Java SDK. The program will record live signals from the EEG device to the tablet via Bluetooth and apply basic signal processing operations (can also be performed in the cloud on Windows through instead of on the tablet with Java) to determine an appropriate level of luminance of a visual filter to superimpose over the display screen of the tablet in real-time. Importantly, this real-time cloud-based function and interaction with the two physical devices (EEG and tablet) needs to operate on a cloud platform with strong security. A secondary component of this program will record EEG signals for a brief period of time before sending the final result to the cloud for processing in . A number of advanced signal processing techniques (already developed in ) will be applied to the signal and the results will be visually displayed for the user on the tablet. The third and final component consists of an encrypted patient portal in the cloud that allows users to login remotely and access all of the aforementioned data and processed signals in a clean, well-designed manner. The focus of the project will be on: real-time connection to the EEG device and Android tablet, manipulation of the Android visual display, encrypted cloud processing of signals, and a user portal to access all resulting data.

title: Evaluating Vector Databases for a Future Project
description: Vector Database Evaluation We're seeking an experienced data scientist or machine learning engineer to evaluate various vector databases and embedding systems for our search application. This is a critical project that will determine the foundation of our search functionality. Key Responsibilities: - Deploy and configure multiple vector search systems (Vectara, Pinecone, FAISS, Milvus) - Load and preprocess a dataset of 1,000 entries - Design and execute performance tests across all systems - Analyze results and compile comprehensive scorecards - Prepare a final report with recommendations Required Skills: - Strong experience with vector databases and embedding models (BERT, GPT) - Proficiency in for data preprocessing - Familiarity with cloud environments and API integrations - Excellent analytical and technical writing skills - Background in machine learning and natural language processing Our team values clear communication and collaborative problem-solving. You'll be expected to provide regular updates and potentially participate in team discussions. We use Slack for day-to-day communication and have weekly video check-ins. Deliverables: 1. Completed scorecards for each vector search system 2. A final report with analysis and recommendations 3. Presentation of findings to the team We have a structured evaluation framework and will provide access to all necessary resources, including cloud environments, API keys, and the entry dataset. Timeline: We aim to complete this evaluation within 1-2 weeks. Your ability to work efficiently while maintaining attention to detail is crucial. If you have experience with API data or search applications, that's a plus but not required. We're looking for someone who can dive deep into the technical aspects while also understanding the broader implications for our application. Please note that this project may lead to further opportunities in implementing the chosen system into our main application. Full Details of the Project are below: Evaluating Vector Databases 1. Vision The goal of this project is to evaluate various vector databases and embedding systems to determine the most effective combination for a searching application. The evaluation will include a range of tests using a dataset of 1,000 entries to assess each system's performance, relevance ranking, and ease of integration. This will help decide which system provides the best balance of accuracy, speed, and scalability for our needs. Samples of Success * A completed scorecard for each vector search system that reflects clear, quantifiable performance metrics. * A final report that includes comprehensive analysis and recommendations based on the test results, showing a clear path to integrate the chosen vector search system into the application. --- 2. Resources To successfully evaluate the vector databases and embedding systems, the following resources are required: Logins and Access * Access to cloud environments or local servers where each vector search system will be deployed. * API keys and access credentials for each vector search system (Vectara, Pinecone, FAISS, Milvus). * API keys and access credentials for embedding models (BERT, GPT embeddings). Data and Tools * A dataset of 1,000 entries from a database, preprocessed and formatted for consistency. * Data preprocessing tools or scripts to ensure consistent formatting across all systems. * Access to benchmarking tools to measure performance metrics like query response time and relevance ranking. Training and Expertise * Technical documentation for each vector search system and embedding model to assist with deployment, configuration, and integration. * Access to training materials or knowledge bases for team members unfamiliar with certain systems. * Expertise in machine learning, natural language processing, and database management for setting up, testing, and analyzing the vector search systems. Scorecard and Evaluation Framework * A standardized scorecard template for recording test results and evaluating each system based on defined criteria. * A checklist for ensuring all tests are conducted uniformly across all systems. Collaboration and Reporting Tools * A shared Google Drive folder or project management tool to store all test results, scorecards, and reports. * Access to communication tools like Slack or Microsoft Teams for real-time collaboration and updates. --- 3. Definition of Done To consider this task complete, the following criteria must be met: User Stories 1. As a Developer: * I have successfully deployed each vector search system in a controlled environment and configured them to handle the data. * I have loaded the dataset of 1,000 entries into each system and executed the defined test cases. * I have filled out a scorecard for each system based on test results and submitted it for review. 2. As a Project Manager: * I have received complete and accurate scorecards for each vector search system. * I have reviewed the scorecards and provided feedback where necessary. * I have compiled a comprehensive report including all test results, observations, and recommendations. 3. As a Stakeholder (Josh): * I have reviewed the completed scorecards and report, finding them thorough and insightful. * I feel confident in the team's evaluation and ready to decide on the best vector search system to implement. 4. As a Team: * We have presented the findings to the team, and a final decision has been made on the vector search system to be implemented. * We have a clear plan for integrating the chosen system into the main application. 5. As an End User (Researcher): * I can perform searches efficiently and accurately using the chosen vector search system. * The system responds quickly, ranks results relevantly, and integrates seamlessly with our existing workflows.

title: Website designer
description: Overall Theme and Feel: Therapeutic and Invigorating: The design should evoke a sense of calm, wellness, and rejuvenation, reflecting the therapeutic nature of your towels. Using a soothing color palette of greens and whites, as you've mentioned, would create a refreshing and clean look. Minimalistic and Modern: A clean, uncluttered layout with plenty of white space will help to convey the luxury and simplicity of your product. 2. Color Scheme: Primary Colors: Green and white. Use different shades of green for accents, such as buttons, headings, and call-to-action sections, while maintaining white as the background color to keep the overall look clean and fresh. Secondary Colors: Soft gray and earthy tones. These can be used for text, borders, or subtle backgrounds to add depth without overpowering the primary color scheme. 3. Typography: Font Style: Use a clean, modern sans-serif font for body text (e.g., Lato or Open Sans) to ensure readability. For headings and titles, consider a slightly bolder or more elegant font (e.g., Montserrat or Raleway) to create a contrast. Font Size: Ensure the font size is large enough for easy reading, especially for the 50+ age group. Headings should stand out, while body text should be comfortable to read. 4. Layout: Header: Include a logo (simple and elegant, possibly using green and white), navigation menu, and a call-to-action button (e.g., "Shop Now" or "Learn More"). The header should be sticky, so it remains visible as users scroll down. Hero Section: A large, high-quality image of your Invigor towels, showing their luxurious texture and design. Overlay a tagline that captures the essence of your product, such as "Rejuvenate Your Skin with Every Use." Include a prominent call-to-action button here. Product Highlights: A section dedicated to showcasing the unique features of the Invigor towels, such as the patented design, non-exfoliating benefits, and use of bamboo viscose. Use icons and short descriptions for easy understanding. About Section: Share your story, highlighting the journey from your family's bookstore to developing a new path in skincare. Include a personal touch by mentioning your interest in NK Killer cells and skincare. Use images and a brief narrative to engage visitors. Product Display: A clean, grid-style display of your towels, each with a high-quality image, brief description, and price. Include a "Buy Now" or "Add to Cart" button for each product. Use hover effects to highlight products when users move their cursor over them. Testimonials: Showcase customer reviews or testimonials to build trust and credibility. Use quotes and images if available to make this section more relatable. Blog Section: Include a section for blog posts where you can share insights about skincare, the benefits of your products, and tips for maintaining healthy skin. This can also help with SEO and engaging your audience. Footer: Include contact information, social media links, a newsletter signup form, and quick links to important pages like About, Shop, Blog, and Contact Us. Use a dark background with white text to differentiate the footer from the rest of the page. 5. User Experience: Responsive Design: Ensure the website is mobile-friendly and looks great on all devices, as many users will access it from smartphones or tablets. Fast Loading: Optimize images and use efficient coding practices to ensure the site loads quickly, enhancing user experience and SEO. Easy Navigation: The site should be easy to navigate, with a clear menu structure and well-organized content. Use breadcrumbs and a search function to help users find what they're looking for. 6. Additional Features: E-commerce Functionality: Integrate a secure shopping cart and checkout system, with multiple payment options available. Consider using WooCommerce for to manage products, orders, and customer data efficiently. SEO Optimization: Use SEO best practices, such as optimizing meta tags, alt text for images, and content keywords, to help your site rank better in search engines. Analytics Integration: Set up Google Analytics to track user behavior, sales, and other key metrics to make informed decisions about marketing and website improvements. This design approach will help create a professional, user-friendly website that effectively showcases the Invigor towels and engages visitors, encouraging them to explore your products and make a purchase.
